Row.Text: Receives [ICON_Science] Science or [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to civilizations that are more advanced than Etiopia Empire (+1 per 3 technologies or civics ahead). +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food from Pasture. +1 [ICON_Production] Production from Pasture on Desert Hills.
Commercial Hub receives +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from the adjacent other districts. All districts receive +2 additional standard adjacency bonus for being adjacent to oasis.

[ICON_Governor] Governors established in a city provide +3% [ICON_Culture] Culture for each Promotion they have earned, including their first. Mines provide +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science if adjacent to an Industrial Zone.

[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to you. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities or from foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to you.[ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from foreign cities provide +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food to you. Other civilizations' [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to Egypt provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for them.
+3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus within 4 hexes of friendly territory. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities or from foreign cities provide +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to you.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement to military melee units. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to each city with encampment. All military units heal completely when this player captures a city with a encampment.
All Cavalry units Gain [ICON_GOLD] Gold equal to 100% that unit's base [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength. Allows city to purchase districts with [ICON_Gold] Gold when this player captures a city.

Roads built in your territory are one level more advanced than usual. Receive +2 [ICON_Production] Production for routes between your own cities. [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to you.
Gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus when defending to all units. Cities with a garrisoned unit get +3 Loyalty per turn, or +5 if it is a Corps or Army.

All Units have +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength from each active Alliance. Fishing Boats provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if Fishing Boats on a reef. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if Fishing Boats adjecent to reef.
Etiopia Empire unique Atomic era unit. Replace the Infantry. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus when fighting in Hill terrain. No [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty in Hill terrain.
Etiopia Empire unique unit: Mehal Sefari
Timurid unique Medieval era unit. Replace the Courser. Can escort moving civilian and support units at their higher [ICON_Movement] Movement speed.
Yugoslavia unique Atomic era unit. Replace the Artillery. No [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty in Hill terrain. No need Oil.
Yugoslavia unique unit: Mountain Gun M48
Morocco unique Industrial era unit. Replace the Cavalry. +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonus on Desert.
Hideki Tojo unique Atomic era unit. Replace the Fighter. Gains +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against fighter aircraft, lower maintenace cost than fighter and gains +50% experience.

A building unique to Etiopia Empire. Replaces the Monument. +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith, Provides +1 Loyalty per turn in this city. If the city already has maximum Loyalty, also provides an additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture.
A building unique to Timurid. Replaces the University. +5 [ICON_Science] Science, +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Bonus [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district.
Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Stecci, unique to Yugoslavia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +3 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. One per City.

Unlocks the Builder ability to construct a Casbah, unique to Morocco.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production, +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +0.5 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Receive +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold if adjacent to other Casbah. Can be built on Desert, Desert Hills and Desert Floodplain.
